author: Reformer Staff
title: BUHS girls nipped by rivals
text:
BUHS girls nipped by rivals 
Reformer Staff Posted: 10/18/2015 08:00:36 PM EDT Updated: 10/18/2015 08:00:36 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge Brattleboro's Bridget Duff, left, attempts to take the ball away from MAU's Abigale Whitman during a varsity soccer game at Brattleboro Union High School on Friday. « 2 » 
BRATTLEBORO >> The MAU varsity girls soccer team scored with 15 minutes remaining on Friday night at Tenney Field and held on to beat rival Brattleboro, 1-0. 
The shots were even at 10 apiece. Megyn Ayotte made eight saves for the hosts. 
"It seems like we're building towards the playoffs," said BUHS coach Edwin de Bruijn. "I have a feeling we will be playing Colchester. Even with eight losses in a row, my girls have stayed motivated." 
The Colonels (4-10) finished the regular season ranked 15th out of 17 teams in Division 1. Burr and Burton and Colchester are atop the standings with identical 14-0 records. Girls Soccer 
LELAND & GRAY 4, OTTER VALLEY 1 
TOWNSHEND >> Ashley Bates had a hat trick to power the Rebels to victory on Friday afternoon. 
After Olivia Drew gave the Otters a 1-0 lead, Bates beat the Otter Valley goalie in a one-on-one situation by chipping the ball over her head. The teams would go to the break deadlocked at 1-1. 
Bates would tally twice in the second half and MacKenzie Boyle also scored, assisted by Jessie Stockwell. Anna Jutras made seven saves for the Rebels. 
"It was a really good way to end the regular season," Leland & Gray coach Lucas Bates told the Reformer. Boys Soccer 
LELAND & GRAY 2, ARLINGTON 1 (OT) Advertisement 
TOWNSHEND >> Owen McDonald scored both goals for the Rebels, who clinched the Marble Valley League C Division title with the victory in extra time. The 9-5 Rebels are trailing only Twin Valley (12-1-1), Winooski (11-3-0), Stowe (8-4-2) and Williamstown (11-3-0) in the Division 3 standings. 
TWIN VALLEY 1, GREEN MOUNTAIN 1 
CHESTER >> Cooper McCoy split the posts for the Chieftains, assisted by Mack Walton, to put the two-time defending champions in a rare hole. But Bret Swanson then scored to pull Twin Valley even and that's how it would stay. The 12-1-1 Wildcats have earned the top seed in the upcoming state tournament. Field Hockey 
BELLOWS FALLS 1, HARTFORD 0 
WESTMINSTER >> With 11:30 to go in the opening half, Hannah Kelly put away a pass from Reagan Baldasaro and that proved to be the game-winner. Brigid Hodsden made two saves for the shutout. The Terriers will take a 10-2-2 record into the Division 3 Tournament. Cross Country 
HANOVER, N.H. >> The Brattleboro Union High School girls and boys teams each placed fourth in the Connecticut Valley Conference Championships. 
Sarah Gallagher, who beat the course record that was set last year, placed fifth overall in 21:50 to lead the BUHS girls. Liz Morse (23:54), Emilia Dick-Fiora (24:05), Catie Yost (24:05) and Kata Blakeson (27:31) rounded out Brattleboro's top five. 
Isaac Freitas-Eagan placed fifth in 18:09 to pace the Brattleboro boys. Josh Meachen (13th), Jonah Koch (24th), Colin Costa-Walsh (25th) and Dan Burdo (35th) also scored for the purple and white. 
The Brattleboro teams will compete in the MVL A Division Championships on Tuesday at Burr and Burton, with the boys leading off at 3:30 p.m. and the girls starting at 4 p.m. 
——— 
HILLSBORO, N.H. >> Rachael Girroir finished third overall in 23:04 to lead the Hinsdale girls on Friday and Hinsdale's Danny O'melia took the bronze in the boys race in 18:34. Those two will be aiming for Top 10 finishes on Tuesday, when the Pacers compete in the Granite State Championships.
